void cfs_expr_list_free_list ( struct list_head *  list  ) 

Frees cfs_expr_list structures of list.

For each struct cfs_expr_list structure found on list it frees range_expr list attached to it and frees the cfs_expr_list itself.

Return values:
none

Print a list of range expressions (expr_list) into specified buffer.

int cfs_gettok ( struct cfs_lstr *  next,
char  delim,
struct cfs_lstr *  res 
)

Extracts tokens from strings.

Looks for delim in string next, sets res to point to substring before the delimiter, sets next right after the found delimiter.

Return values:
1 if res points to a string of non-whitespace characters
0 otherwise

static int cfs_range_expr_parse ( struct cfs_lstr *  src,
unsigned  min,
unsigned  max,
int  bracketed,
struct cfs_range_expr **  expr 
) [static]

Parses <range_expr> token of the syntax.

If bracketed is false, src should only have a single token which can be <number> or \*

Return values:
pointer to allocated range_expr and initialized range_expr::re_lo, range_expr::re_hi and range_expr:re_stride if src parses to <number> | <number> '-' <number> | <number> '-' <number> '/' <number>
0 will be returned if it can be parsed, otherwise -EINVAL or -ENOMEM will be returned.

Converts string to integer.

Accepts decimal and hexadecimal number recordings.

Return values:

0 otherwise
